name: BIOC 163A
title: Quantum Mechanics, Spectroscopy and Molecular Structure for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
description: Detailed introduction to molecular quantum mechanics and application of spectroscopic and diffraction techniques to problems involving biological macromolecules. Designed as an alternative to CHEM 163A for the biochemistry and molecular biology major requirement. Students cannot receive credit for this course and CHEM 163A.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): CHEM 1B and CHEM 1C, or CHEM 3C, or CHEM 4B; and PHYS 5A and 5C, or PHYS 6A and 6C; and previous or concurrent enrollment in PHYS 5B or PHYS 6B.

class_notes: Enroll in lecture and associated discussion section
